availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Ballow (Pulaski County, Kentucky, resident and captain in 12th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.))

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James Ballow and Frances Ballow. Married to Phoebe C. Smith Ballow in Pulaski County, Kentucky, on October 16, 1856. Father of Humphrey M. Ballow. Married to Susannah E. Ballow. Father of Joseph H. Ballow and Ellen Ballow. Student in Pulaski County in 1850. Resident of Pulaski County in 1860. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain from January 30, 1862, to April 5, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Division 1, p. 66A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, District 2, p. 73.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Point, p. 296A.

"Grand Old Man Passes Away at Stanford," The Advocate-Messenger (Danville, Kentucky), June 15, 1921, p. 1 and 8.
